subject: Re: [junit] Testable Interface / "unit" (?) testing
msgSnippet: Programmer Testing is: 1. Whatever kind of testing I need to help me be confident that I am implementing software components correctly. 2. Whatever kind of
messageBody:
Programmer Testing is:

1. Whatever kind of testing I need to help me be confident that I am
implementing software components correctly.
2. Whatever kind of testing I need to create an effective safety net
for refactoring.

Comments?

[PS: I just don't call 'em unit tests anymore.]

So said Eric Armstrong on 2/9/2003 --------------------

<snip />
>And that thought brings back the famous game show line:
> "Will the real unit testing please stand up?"
>
>What the heck *is* unit testing, anyway? If it is "class methods",
then
>JUnitDoclet made sense. But if it is "basic operations", isn't that
more
>
>like integration testing? Or is there a middle ground, say, as
package-
>level operations?
<snip />


J. B. Rainsberger,
